metadata.titel_preek: Easter Season: From Darkness to Revelation

kernfrasen: Jesus has entered the realm of Death
the dead must cross over the black waters
He arose from the kingdom of Death
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: DEATH IS A PHYSICAL LOCATION / JOURNEY TO A REALM
GOD IS A RELATIONAL PARTNER (NOT A POSSESSION)

kernfrasen: evidence that will hold up in the courts of the skeptics

cognitieve_implicaties: Death is an active agent that captures the living
theologische_implicaties: Humanity is passive and powerless in the face of mortality
onbedoelde_consequenties: Death might be seen as a rival power to God (dualism)

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the dead metaphor of 'death's grip' by linking it to specific losses (career, health, youth).

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the overarching container metaphor of 'Night/Darkness' to unify the three distinct texts (John 20 and Job). The transition from 'Night' to 'Light' provides a consistent cognitive path.

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_b: God as 'not a domesticated household pet'
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The preacher warns against domesticating God while simultaneously emphasizing a personal, relational 'Who'.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: A 'Who' implies intimacy, while 'not a pet' implies radical alterity.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher redefines 'dust' from a symbol of mortality (Lent) to a symbol of creaturely peace (Easter).

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activating the 'Night' metaphor by connecting it to the 'black waters of the Styx' and the 'cold clasp' of modern losses.
sterktes.voorbeeld: It will seem to you like the tomb of hope.

risicos.beschrijving: The use of Greek mythology (Styx) might confuse the source of the doctrine of the descent into hell.
risicos.voorbeeld: the dead must cross over the black waters of the river Styx
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may blend pagan mythology with Christian eschatology.

sub_worlds: The ruins of a tornado-hit church in Alabama

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; bridges the historical event to personal grief.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Through the Joban imagery of planets, orbits, and beasts.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Highlighting the 'nail prints' and the 'whirlwind' that offers no explanations.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligned with the Easter/Lenten cycle (Dust to Resurrection).

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the 'LIGHT/DARK' and 'CONTAINER' (Realm of Death) schemas. It successfully moves from the 'Night' of the tomb to the 'Whirlwind' of Job, maintaining a focus on the limits of human perception versus divine revelation.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the 'physicality' of the wounds as the preacher did with Thomas.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The texture of the scar tissue in Jesus' side.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly link the 'Voice' in the whirlwind to the 'Voice' that calls Mary by name.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If faith requires sight, those who don't see are excluded.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize the 'Word' as the new 'Source' of sight (as the preacher began to do).

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To bridge the 'ruins' of the Alabama church with the 'building' of the Kingdom.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to bridge existential despair with theological hope through the consistent use of the 'Night' and 'Dust' schemas.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Focuses on the cognitive mapping of 'Night' as a realm of power rather than just a poetic mood.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond learning styles to the fundamental conceptual structures of how the hearer 'sees' God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals how the preacher uses the 'Dust' metaphor to flip the hearer's schema from 'mortality' to 'comfort' through a shift in the source domain's entailments.

appendices.notities: The preacher effectively uses 'Night' as a primary conceptual container for all human suffering.
